de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.button

Class PButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tum.bgu.lfk.processing.button.PButton

  • public class PButton
extends java.lang.Object
    a simple button class to use within processing. action handling should by done via the e.g. mouseClicked() functions etc.
    at the moment the button does not adjust themself to the caption (text)
    Since:
    12.06.2014
    Version:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Mathias Jahnke, Technische Universität München, Department of Cartography

      • PButton

        public PButton()
        default constructor
        should not be used!

      • PButton

        @Deprecated
public PButton(float x,
                  float y,
                  float buttonWidth,
                  float buttonHeight,
                  processing.core.PApplet p)
        Deprecated. 
        parameterized constructor. x, y will specify the center point of the button object.
        Parameters:
        x - x-value of the button's center point in screen coordinates (pixel)
        y - y-value of the button's center point in screen coordinates (pixel)
        buttonWidth - width of the button in pixel
        buttonHeight - height of the button in pixel
        p - the PApplet

      • PButton

        @Deprecated
public PButton(float x,
                  float y,
                  float buttonWidth,
                  float buttonHeight,
                  java.lang.String buttonLabel,
                  processing.core.PApplet p)
        Deprecated. 
        parameterized constructor. x, y will specify the center point of the button object
        Parameters:
        x - x-value of the buttons center point in screen coordinates
        y - y-value of the buttons center point in screen coordinates
        buttonWidth - button width
        buttonHeight - button height
        buttonLabel - the button label
        p - the PApplet to draw on

       processing.core.PApplet p)
        Parameters:
        x - x-value of the buttons center point
        y - y-value of the buttons center point
        text - the label of the button
        p - PApplet

      • setChecked

        public void setChecked(boolean clicked)
        set to true if the button is clicked

      • isChecked

        public boolean isChecked()
        return true if the button is clicked otherwise false
        Returns:
        boolean

      • changeChecked

        public void changeChecked()
        changes the status of checked from true to false or vice versa

      • setFont

        public void setFont(processing.core.PFont labelFont)
        sets a new PFont for the button label. If width or height not explicitly set the button adapt automatically to the new font
        Parameters:
        labelFont - the new PFont

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        sets the button text. if the width or height not explicitly set the button size adapt automatically to the new text
        Parameters:
        text - the new button text

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        return the text to display with the button
        Returns:
        String

      • adaptToLabel

        @Deprecated
public void adaptToLabel(boolean adaptToLabelWidth,
                           boolean adaptToLabelHeight)
        Deprecated. 
        has to be true if the button should adapt themself to the label size
        Parameters:
        adaptToLabelWidth - boolean

      • getWidth

        public float getWidth()
        Returns:
        the button width

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(float width)
        to set the buttonWidth manual. if the button width is set manually the button does no longer adapt them self to a new font or text
        Parameters:
        width -

      • getHeight

        public float getHeight()
        Returns:
        the button height

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(float height)
        sets the button height. if the button height is set manually the button does no longer adapt them self to a new font or text.
        Parameters:
        height -

      • setCornerRadius

        public void setCornerRadius(float cornerRadius)
        to set the corner radius of the button. the default value for corner radius is 0.
        Parameters:
        cornerRadius -

      • setOutlineWeight

        public void setOutlineWeight(float outlineWeight)
        to set the outline weight of the button (stroke thickness)
        Parameters:
        outlineWeight -

      • draw

        public void draw()
        draws the button every time the function is called should be placed within draw-function of the processing sketch

      • setButtonLook

        @Deprecated
public void setButtonLook(java.lang.Integer stroke,
                            java.lang.Integer strokeHighlight,
                            java.lang.Integer fill,
                            java.lang.Integer fillHighlight)
        Deprecated. 
        this method is renamed set the outline and stroke color of the button if not called standard values are used at this stage only int values can be passed to the function to use this function with rgb colors use the color()-function as an argument. the color() function will map the rgb values to a integer
        Parameters:
        stroke - color of the button border if the button is not clicked
        strokeHighlight - color of the button border if the button is clicked
        fill - color of the button fill if the button is not clicked
        fillHighlight - color of the button fill if the button is clicked

      • setStyling

        public void setStyling(java.lang.Integer stroke,
              java.lang.Integer strokeHighlight,
              java.lang.Integer fill,
              java.lang.Integer fillHighlight)
        set the outline and stroke color of the button if not called standard values are used at this stage only int values can be passed to the function to use this function with rgb colors use the color()-function as an argument. the color() function will map the rgb values to a integer
        Parameters:
        stroke - color of the button border if the button is not clicked
        strokeHighlight - color of the button border if the button is clicked
        fill - color of the button fill if the button is not clicked
        fillHighlight - color of the button fill if the button is clicked

      • setButtonLabel

        @Deprecated
public void setButtonLabel(java.lang.String text,
                             int textColor,
                             int textColorHighlight)
        Deprecated. 
        sets the caption (text) of the button and the styling of the caption
        Parameters:
        text - the label of the button
        textColor - the text color
        textColorHighlight - the text color if the button is highlighted

      • setTextStyling

        public void setTextStyling(int textColor,
                  int textColorHighlight)
        sets the color for the button text. If not called default values are used.
        Differentiates between a color and a color if the button is clicked or used as a toggle button
        Parameters:
        textColor -
        textColorHighlight -

        Parameters:

        buttonFont - the PFont of the button
        buttonTextColor - the caption (text) color
        buttonTextColorHighlight - the caption (text) color if the button is highlighted

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(float x,
               float y)
        checks if the x and y coordinates are falling inside the button area
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate
        y - the y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if inside otherwise false
